title: Alleged Antifa group posts photo with rifles, say they’re ready for Civil War 2, you fascists
text:
We don’t know much about Anti-Fascist Action of America other than they opened a Twitter account in September and may or may not be a parody account. They also have 242 followers and have the hashtag #F**kAmerica in their bio.

The only reason we know anything about them is that they got some attention Tuesday for posting a photo of men and women with rifles along with the message, “We’re ready for your #CivilWar2, Fascists.”

One thing’s certain: the photo isn’t new; it’s of the Phoenix John Brown Gun Club back in 2017. The gun club’s Facebook page does connect the club with “Redneck Revolt,” a far-left, anti-capitalist group, though. (They have the hammer and sickle in their Twitter bio too.)

So, while we ponder whether or not this is an elaborate parody or not, see if the following tweet makes you quake in your boots.

That’s probably not the wisest thing to tweet to the president, but you do you.

Great parody account! — Adam (@idrawrobots) October 1, 2019

Wow- I bet these guys could totally take on a Canadian granny in a walker trying to cross the street! — Can't Stop The Corn Pop (@Fenway_Nation) October 1, 2019

Congrats 🎊 you understand the second amendment is necessary to fight fascism. Now let’s work on the first amendment! — Jesse Peterson (@kuramajp) October 1, 2019

Very cute. — Where Am I? (@Zaiphe) October 1, 2019

Oh…you dont want us to bring it. Trust me. — PrimalRage7 (@primalrage7) October 1, 2019

I thought you wanted those guns banned. But now I actually love to see this because you’re realizing what the second amendment is for — TN Libertarian (@TNLibertarian) October 1, 2019

Narrator: “A sane group of people would understand the irony of saying, ‘Fuck America’ while standing with a loaded rifle in the only place in the world where your ability to do so is enumerated in its Constitution. These are not sane people.” https://t.co/b4SKpBYj6K — Nasty Canasta (@nasty_canasta) October 1, 2019

Candidate for tweet of the year https://t.co/3voGgkrYK0 — Robert B (@PatriotBeez) October 1, 2019

Is that a parody account? — Shawn (@Shawn_on_Games) October 1, 2019

Yet they look to have their rifles pointed at each other’s lower legs or feet area. First sonic crack will sort the men from the boys — Thomas Fagan (@Thomas_Fagan) October 1, 2019

And the toes from the feet…

And the feet from the legs… — PSEUDONONYMOUS (@CIAMemeEngineer) October 1, 2019

As they stand poised to shoot their loaded weapons into the feet of their Comrades – just slightly less disabling than ‘shooting yourself in the foot’. — El ‘Known Bro’ Tiburón (@bay_snark) October 1, 2019

Pro tip: Go on a diet first. You look like you couldn’t slow jog a block without getting gassed.#SNORT — While Supplies Last (@corrcomm) October 1, 2019

Y’all might want to get in a little aerobic exercise. — Alberto en Fuego (@AlbertoenFuego1) October 1, 2019

How cute. Summer children playing at revolution with full bellies and soft hands. You know not what you ask. — Al Freeman (@AlbertonFreeman) September 30, 2019

Some one toss a soy latte at that group if you want to see a fight. — Erik Fritts (@ErikFritts75) October 1, 2019

Or an avocado in center of the crowd. Lol — OomBoerSeun (@notMyName9966) October 1, 2019

This must be a comedy account… if not… pic.twitter.com/E6abwHU1yt — CollapsitARian-15 (@thefreerifleman) October 1, 2019

It’s got to be.

Obviously your group will first target the elderly after the events of this past weekend. — The Camo(papa) Who Laughs… (@camopapa0410) October 1, 2019

@BetoORourke does not approve this message — Let’s Talk Awesome (@TCA_Reviews) October 1, 2019

If I wasn't already convinced on voting for Trump, I am now. #Trump2020 — High Calibur X (@JoshTip31352006) October 1, 2019

I'd say that your employer probably wouldn't like this, but who am I kidding 🤣 — Ric 🍙 (@realRiceKun) October 1, 2019

The picture is hysterical…my husband & I laughed for ten mins after we saw it. This is one of the best parody accounts on Twitter. 😂

Sane people realize you don’t go walking around like that unless you’re looking to get a REAL cap popped in your ass. — © Amy Burnett 🇺🇸 (@AA_Burnett) October 1, 2019

Is this supposed to be intimidating? — Not an average saiyan warrior (@fnafguy4561) October 1, 2019

i think its a parody account. — GwenBlanketKnight All Hallows Eve Fan Account (@BlanketKnight) October 1, 2019

Gotta be.

Every antifa account is parody. — RayfromNJ (@NjRayfrom) October 1, 2019

Good point.

description: We thought leftists wanted these sorts of assault rifles banned and sold back to the government.
